result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose A. Sanchez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000-$100,000 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose A. Sanchez

defendant.name: Sanchez, Jose A.
defendant.address: Racine Correctional Institution 2019 Wisconsin St, Sturtevant, WI 53177

records.addlTxt:
Restitution Ordered in the amount of $45,740.31
Plus 10% Restitution Surcharge

Case called at 11:03 AM.
Defendant Jose A. Sanchez appeared by video, in custody from Racine Correctional.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for Jose A. Sanchez.  Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant waives his right to personal appearance. Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing. 
State to file Information within 48 hours. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads to Count 1: Theft-Movable Property >$10,000-$100,000; Repeater.  
Sentence is Withheld and the Defendant is placed on 6 Years of Probation (Concurrent to any current sentence) with the following conditions:
Restitution in the amount of $45,740.31 plus the 10% surcharge for a total of $50,314.34 (to be paid to R.M. or his estate).
No contact with R.M. or his residence/estate. 180 Days of Jail with Huber, stayed pending further order of the Court.
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Court Costs/surcharges.
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
Restitution Review Hearing: 3/16/27 at 9:00 AM to review the Defendant's plan to pay restitution. Court does not expect restitution to be paid in full by this date.
Plea hearing on September 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:22am Defendant Jose A. Sanchez not in court, in custody in Racine County. Due to Court running late case was rescheduled. Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for Jose A. Sanchez.  Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Hearing: 09/21/22 at 11am

9:50 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jose A. Sanchez appeared by video, in custody from Racine Correctional Institute.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for Jose A. Sanchez. This case has been set for a plea hearing on 09/14/22 at 10am in Br. 4.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jose A. Sanchez appeared by video, in custody from Racine Correction.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for Jose A. Sanchez. Defense needs a new date.
Hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 9:46 AM. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jose A. Sanchez appeared by video, in custody from Racine Correctional.  
Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for Jose A. Sanchez.  Attorney Yonko requests new dates.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 5/16/22 at 2:00 PM.
RTN: 6/8/22 at 9:30 AM.
